docs.lead_paragraph: The president’s proposal to raise minimum wage to $9 an hour directly addresses the country’s yawning levels of inequality.

headline.seo: Obama Pushes for Increase in Federal Minimum Wage
headline.main: Raising Minimum Wage Would Ease Income Gap but Carries Political Risks
headline.print_headline: Raising Minimum Wage Would Ease Income Gap but Carries Political Risks

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, in State of the Union address, calls on Congress to raise the federal minimum wage to $9 an hour from $7.25, and to automatically adjust it with inflation; proposal would address nation's yawning levels of income inequality, but is also bound to be politically divisive given the weakness of the nation's economic recovery.
docs.snippet: The president’s proposal to raise minimum wage to $9 an hour directly addresses the country’s yawning levels of inequality.

headline.main: Rubio’s G.O.P. Response to the State of the Union Address

docs.snippet: The following is the text as prepared for delivery of Senator Marco Rubio’s Republican response to the State of the Union address.

docs.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Swedish will resign as chief of Trinity Health to take the same position with WellPoint as it goes through changes under the new health care law.

headline.seo: WellPoint Hires Joseph Swedish of Trinity Health as C.E.O.
headline.main: Big Insurer Hires a Hospital Executive as Chief
headline.print_headline: Big Insurer, WellPoint, Hires Hospital Executive as Chief

docs.abstract: WellPoint, one of the nation's largest health insurers, hires Joseph R Swedish of Trinity Health, as its chief executive to lead it through sweeping changes created by the federal health care overhaul law.
docs.snippet: Joseph R. Swedish will resign as chief of Trinity Health to take the same position with WellPoint as it goes through changes under the new health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Administrators at several campuses said it was students who brought the issue to their attention, part of a push to accommodate transgender students.

headline.seo: Transgender Students Gain Visibility, and College Health Plans Respond
headline.main: College Health Plans Respond as Transgender Students Gain Visibility
headline.print_headline: College Health Plans Respond as Transgender Students Gain Visibility

docs.abstract: Growing number of colleges are adapting their health plans to cover the specific needs of transgender students, including hormone therapy and gender reassignment surgery; rapid shift follows decade of activism and an increased visibility on campus.
docs.snippet: Administrators at several campuses said it was students who brought the issue to their attention, part of a push to accommodate transgender students.

docs.lead_paragraph: Drug makers say a system of discounts intended for low-income and uninsured patients is being abused, but hospitals say they can’t do business without it.

headline.seo: Drug Industry Says 340B Discount Program Is Being Abused
headline.main: Dispute Develops Over Discount Drug Program
headline.print_headline: Drug Industry Sees Abuse in Discount Program

docs.abstract: Drug makers say a program known as 340B, which requires them to provide discounts of 20 to 50 percent to hospitals and clinics that treat low-income and uninsured patients, is being abused; pharmaceutical industry wants to rein in the discounts, but hospitals insist that they cannot do business without them and would have to cut services without the program.
docs.snippet: Drug makers say a system of discounts intended for low-income and uninsured patients is being abused, but hospitals say they can’t do business without it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Live Coverage of Obama's State of the Union Address

docs.abstract: President Obama delivers his State of the Union address Tuesday night and Times reporters are providing live updates and analysis.
docs.snippet: President Obama delivers his State of the Union address Tuesday night and Times reporters are providing live updates and analysis.

headline.main: Debate Over Brain Scans and Alzheimer's

docs.abstract: An expert panel convened by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services concluded that data supporting use of PET scans to diagnose Alzheimer's was weak.
docs.snippet: An expert panel convened by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services concluded that data supporting use of PET scans to diagnose Alzheimer's was weak.

docs.lead_paragraph: A slowdown linked to a weak economy and structural changes could help alleviate the country’s fiscal troubles.

headline.seo: Sharp Slowdown in U.S. Health Care Costs Eases Deficit
headline.main: Slower Growth of Health Costs Eases Budget Deficit
headline.print_headline: Slower Growth Of Health Costs Narrows Deficit

docs.abstract: Sharp and surprisingly persistent slowdown in the growth of health care costs is helping to narrow the federal deficit; budget experts are trying to figure out whether the trend will last and how much the slower growth could help alleviate the country’s long-term fiscal problems; Congressional Budget Office has erased hundreds of billions of dollars in projected spending on Medicare and Medicaid; new data also show overall health care spending growth continuing at the lowest rate in decades for a fourth consecutive year.
docs.snippet: A slowdown linked to a weak economy and structural changes could help alleviate the country’s fiscal troubles.

docs.lead_paragraph: Although how you use your human capital can have a major impact, few financial advisers measure it or discuss its impact on your prosperity.

headline.seo: Tapping Into Human Capital, an Important Asset
headline.main: The Biggest Financial Asset in Your Portfolio Is You
headline.print_headline: The Biggest Financial Asset in Your Portfolio Is You

docs.abstract: Financial advisers seldom calculate important factor of human capital, an individual's varying ability to improve their fortune, during wealth and retirement planning.
docs.snippet: Although how you use your human capital can have a major impact, few financial advisers measure it or discuss its impact on your prosperity.

docs.lead_paragraph: To an accountant, questions about tax liability are straightforward, but their answers may surprise people who are not used to such calculations.

headline.seo: Understanding Tax Increases After the Fiscal Deal

docs.abstract:
Wealthier tax payers will face host of difficult decisions as they adapt to 
changes in 2013 tax code; accountants offer four basic questions that taxpayers should ask themselves before making investments aimed at avoiding new taxes.
docs.snippet: To an accountant, questions about tax liability are straightforward, but their answers may surprise people who are not used to such calculations.
